**AI Assistant:**
With the release of version 0.9.2, Verus has introduced several significant features and enhancements that improve the platform's functionality, user experience, and overall capabilities. 

Let me walk you through some of the key features and enhancements. **Enhanced Privacy Features** are one of the major highlights of this update. Users can now create identities on both the mainnet and testnet with increased privacy, which is crucial for those who value their security and privacy when interacting with the Verus network.

Another significant development is **Protocol Feature Completeness**. The Verus network, including its public blockchains as a service (PBaaS), VerusID extensions, and Verus DeFi protocols, are now considered feature complete. This means that the core developer focus has shifted from feature development to protocol hardening and enabling usage, followed by user experience upgrades and supporting infrastructure development.

The new **3D Cross-Chain Liquidity Network Visualizer** in Verus Desktop is another exciting addition. This visualizer provides a graphical representation of currency conversion and fractional network connections both on-chain and cross-chain. Users can now move around, zoom in and out, and explore the network in 3 dimensions, gaining a more intuitive understanding of the complex relationships within the Verus ecosystem.

Lastly, **New PBaaS Capabilities** have been added, making all PBaaS capabilities available on the new Verus testnet. This enables developers to start building and testing their applications on the Verus platform, taking advantage of its transformative technologies. The goal is to achieve interoperability on the new testnet, with the Ethereum/Rinkeby bridge being a key milestone.

What are some of the key features and enhancements that have been added to Verus in version 0.9.2, and how do they improve the overall functionality and user experience of the platform?

With the release of version 0.9.2, Verus has introduced several significant features and enhancements that improve the platform's functionality, user experience, and overall capabilities. 

**Enhanced Privacy Features:** 
One of the key features of version 0.9.2 is the provision of enhanced privacy features for identity creation on both the mainnet and testnet. This is a crucial development for users who value their privacy and security when interacting with the Verus network.

**Protocol Feature Completeness:** 
The Verus network, including its public blockchains as a service (PBaaS), VerusID extensions, and Verus DeFi protocols, are now considered feature complete. This means that the core developer focus has shifted from feature development to protocol hardening and enabling usage, followed by user experience upgrades and supporting infrastructure development.

**3D Cross-Chain Liquidity Network Visualizer:** 
Verus Desktop now includes a new 3-dimensional cross-chain network visualizer, which provides a graphical representation of currency conversion and fractional network connections both on-chain and cross-chain. This visualizer allows users to move around, zoom in and out, and explore the network in 3 dimensions, providing a more intuitive understanding of the complex relationships within the Verus ecosystem.

**New PBaaS Capabilities:** 
All PBaaS capabilities, including those for application development, are now available on the new Verus testnet. This enables developers to start building and testing their applications on the Verus platform, taking advantage of its transformative technologies. The goal is to achieve interoperability on the new testnet, with the Ethereum/Rinkeby bridge being a key milestone.

IF YOU HAVE ALREADY USED TESTNET WITH VERSIONS PRIOR TO v0.9.2, MAKE SURE TO DELETE AND CLEAR ANY EXISTING TESTNET DATA FOLDERS AS DESCRIBED BELOW.FOR MAINNET (AND TESTNET), v0.9.2 PROVIDES ENHANCED PRIVACY FEATURES FOR IDENTITY CREATION## PROTOCOL FEATURE COMPLETE
With v0.9.2, The Verus network, public blockchains as a service (PBaaS), VerusID extensions, and Verus DeFi protocols are considered feature complete for the coming mainnet PBaaS upgrade. The core developer focus now is protocol hardening and enabling usage first, followed by user experience upgrades and supporting infrastructure such as identity and login support for lite mode, mobile and web extension wallets as well as merge mining for pool servers.## NEW 3D CROSS-CHAIN LIQUIDITY NETWORK VISUALIZER (GUI FOR TESTNET)
In v0.9.2 Verus Desktop, there is a new 3-dimensional cross-chain network visualizer, which shows all currency conversion and fractional network connections both on chain and cross-chain, with the ability to move around and zoom in and out in 3 dimensions. To access the visualizer, click on “Visualize Network” on the Metaverse tab of Verus Desktop. If you’re interested in seeing the visualizer now, here’s a link directly to the visualizer as part of a recent video members of the community helped make (https://youtu.be/CkgUVjx_g1M?t=43).## NEW PBAAS CAPABILITIES
All PBaaS capabilities, including for application development, are available now on the new Verus testnet. Our goal for interoperability on this new testnet is to launch the Ethereum/Rinkeby bridge in the next couple days. Now would be a good time for development capable projects hoping to get a head start on using Verus’s transformative technologies to do a deep dive on the Verus testnet.
